definition: to skimp on the job and stint on materials (idiom)/jerry-building/sloppy work
to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish

sentences.english: The complexity of a jerry-rigged firewall will undermine its effectiveness.
sentences.chinese: 一个偷工减料的防火墙，其复杂性将削弱其效力。

sentences.english: Those collapsed houses were all jerry-built.
sentences.chinese: 那些倒塌的房子都是偷工减料盖的。

sentences.english: Ultra low prices very likely " jerry-built".
sentences.chinese: 超低价格极有可能是“偷工减料”。

sentences.english: Then, in building materials, buildings, the construction of shoddy work.
sentences.chinese: 然后，在建筑材料上以次充好，施工上偷工减料。

sentences.english: There's no scrimping and saving on this board.
sentences.chinese: 有没有偷工减料，并在此板储蓄。

sentences.english: Some workers to cut corners, in white latex confirmed in water.
sentences.chinese: 有些工人为了偷工减料，在白乳胶中兑水。

sentences.english: Zhang Rui said that the cabinet industry's most prone to the problem of shoddy work.
sentences.chinese: 张锐表示，橱柜行业最容易出现的问题是偷工减料。

sentences.english: Those dishonest builders always try to cut corners.
sentences.chinese: 那些存心不良的建筑商老想偷工减料。

sentences.english: Ono Custom Rods thanks Jerry for this history lesson.
sentences.chinese: 大野功统习俗棒感谢偷工减料，为这个历史的教训。

definition: to skimp on the job/to avoid work
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
jerry-built building project/lit. built on soybean dregs
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column/to replace the original with a fake/to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
when radishes are selling fast, one doesn't take the time to wash the soil off them (idiom)/fig. when business is booming, merchants tend to offer goods of inferior quality
pinyin: luo2 bo5 kuai4 le5 bu4 xi3 ni2

definition: to counterfeit/to pass off a fake as genuine
